728442f-b.text:
Arthur Kill Road, north side, at the head of Richmond
Road, showing the G. Housman House, dating back to pre-Revolutionary days. It is also known as the "House of Buried Treasure" in which gold was found in 1857 and 1921.

May 1, 1926
P.L. Sperr

(2)
The same, as seen from Richmond Road.
May 1, 1926
P.L. Sperr

(3)
An additional view of the house, viewed along Richmond
Road from Court Street.

July 15, 1927
P.L. Sperr  No REPRODUCTIONS ~

728443f-a.text:
(1)
Arthur Kill Road, north side, at the head of Richmond Road, showing the G. Homan Hose, dating back to pre-Revolutionary times. It is also known as the "House of Buried Treasure' in which gold was found in 1857 and 1921. The view is from
Richmond Road.

February 1, 1939

728443f-b.original_title: Richmond: Arthur Kill Road - Richmond Road

728446f-a.text:
Arthur Kill Road (automobiles thereon) west from Richmond Road (rig.ut) to Center Street. The 2 -D -story frame house, at the head of Richmond Road and adjoining the Fairway Club, is the G. Homian House, also known as the "House of Buried Treasure," dating back to pre-Revolutionary days. The vkew is northward from the Staten Island Historical Society Museum at Center Street and Court Place. In the background is Latourette
Park.
April 6, 1938
P. L. Sperr
(2)
The same, another view.
April 6, 1938
L. Spc r

728444f-a.text:
Arthur Kill Roa d, at the S.E. corner of Richmond Road, showing the former parish house of t. Andrews P. E. Church. I 1874 (Beerss map) the house belonged to Oliver
Hodge.
June 13, 1927
P. L. Sperr

728445f-b.text:
(1)
Arthur Kill Road, north side, west from Richmond Road to Center Street. The first house is the G. Homan house. It is also known as the "House of Buried Treasure'in which
gold was found in 1857 and 1921.
December 9, 1924
By Wm. T. Davis
Through P. L. Sperr
(2)
The same, another view.
May 1, 1926
P. L. Sperr
(3)
An exclusive view of the G. Homan house.
August 23, 1916
By Wm. T. Davis
Through P. L. Sperr
